page.title: 01THE CROUGHTON AREA
page.content: The 12 km block covered by this survey covers the southern tip of Northants and a margin of Oxon, missing the Bucks borderby 3/4km. It is a rural area, mainly farmland, containing the village of Croughton, the main subject for consideration in this survey. It has not been possible to survey Souldern, the village in the SW corner of our area, as it is far more remote than mere geography might suggest, being located in Oxon. Croughton is an ancient village - the{Romans}were here - and it was mentioned in the first Domesday survey. There are some 1245 inhabitants and 350 dwellings. In addition to the village, the US Base located to the East of the area has a flexible population, but 111 dwelling houses and accommodation blocks for 200 personnel.
